titleStmt.title: Jesse N. Reno to James F. Robinson
CWG8949

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Greenville. Ky July 31 1863.
Muhlenberg Circuit Court
Clks Office
To His Excellency
Gov Robinson
Dear Sir

Enclosed you find, Judgements against the Justices of this County for a failure to keep a Suitable Jail, This is a case where executive Clemency, might verry justly be extended, I have acted as County Clerk for Eight years, and the officers of the County Court have from time to time made levies and appropriated the same to the repairs and comfort of the Jail, And with proper carful Jailers -- the Jail is ample and secure -- though close & not very commodious yet -- there has not been any Searious Sickness in it, and in my Judgment no good reason to pronounce it unhealthy a new Jail is now offered to contractors but not yet let. in With the facts all before me & my personal Knowledge of Same -- I can not, hesitate in saying this is a proper action to exercise the power of your office in remitting the fines imposed.

Your Obt Sert
Jesse N Reno Clk & Trustee of Jury found for Muhg County Ky

His Excellency Gov Robinson
Frankfort
Kenty --
